VANESSA YURKEVICH: The majestic
allure of the Hamptons is real.

That's why I've been
coming every year
for the past 10 years.

But recently, it's become
a summer playground
for east coast millennials.

There's all that chaos, and
then there's the Hamptons
that I grew up with.

One of the things you have
to do if you're heading out

to Montauk is stop at a place
called The Lobster Roll,

but most people
know it as lunch.

It has some of the best
lobster rolls on the island.

Parking is going to be
tough, but it's worth it.

Why is this the spot
where everyone comes?

- Well, we do have
our iconic lunch sign.

That's one of the first things
that people see as they're
heading in and out of Montauk.

This is our 52nd summer,
so we opened in 1965,

and it's been owned by the same
family for all of those years.

That's delicious.

The exclusive part of

used to be about which dinner

Now it's about which

There's wait lists and then
lines, and then packed classes.

This is supposed to be the

But now it is the
place to be in Montauk.

That is, if you

And one of the

Like this little tucked away

If you spend enough

and especially out
here in Montauk,

you'll start to hear about

It's this intoxicating feeling
that really can't be described

And where I'm standing right

Back when I first

these were the types of

Sure, the parties

This is my Hamptons.
